meanings.definition: Suggesting or implying something in an indirect or subtle way.
meanings.sent1: Her insinuative smile hinted at a hidden meaning.
meanings.sent2: The insinuative tone of his voice made me suspicious.
meanings.sent3: The insinuative cat toyed with the dangling string, teasing the dog.
meanings.sent4: The insinuative shadows in the painting added depth to the scene.
meanings.sent5: The insinuative message left us wondering about its true intent.

meanings.definition: Tending to insinuate or introduce gradually or subtly.
meanings.sent1: His insinuative behavior made it hard to trust him.
meanings.sent2: The insinuative way she brought up the topic piqued my interest.
meanings.sent3: The insinuative plant slowly spread its vines across the garden.
meanings.sent4: The insinuative melody crept into my mind and stayed there.
meanings.sent5: The insinuative scent of the flowers filled the room with a delicate fragrance.
